titlestmt.titleproper: Christopher Coenen Collection on P. T. Barnum and Tom ThumbMS254

publicationstmt.publisher: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-03 10:15:34 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.unittitle: Christopher Coenen Collection on P. T. Barnum and Tom Thumb
did.abstract: This collection contains material related to P. T. Barnum and Tom Thumb collected by Christopher Coenen, including prints, photographs, and programs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Christopher Coenen A'71, 2018, accession number MS-2019-048.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in one chronological series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Christopher Coenen Collection on P. T. Barnum and Tom Thumb, 1850-1977. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing of this collection was completed by Leah Edelman in 2019. Materials were placed in archival boxes, and loose materials were placed in folders where needed. Materials were arranged in one series with chronological order. A file and item-level inventory and series-level description were created, and the finding aid was also created at the time of processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains material related to P .T. Barnum and Tom Thumb collected by Christopher Coenen, including a print of General Tom Thumb; photographs, cards, and prints of Jumbo; a Ringling Brothers and Barnum and Bailey Circus program; and a portfolio of print reproductions of portrait photographs originally taken by Matthew Brady of members of Barnum's troupe.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Any intellectual property rights that the donor possesses have been transferred to Tufts University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Christopher Joseph Coenen graduated from the Tufts University School of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering with a B.S. degree in 1971.

did.unittitle: Christopher Coenen Collection on P.T. Barnum and Tom Thumb

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains a print of General Tom Thumb; photographs, cards, and prints of Jumbo; a Ringling Brothers and Barnum and Bailey Circus program; and a portfolio of print reproductions of portrait photographs originally taken by Matthew Brady of members of Barnum's troupe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains two photographs of Jumbo in Barnum Hall and one photograph of the fire at Barnum Hall in 1975; a print titled "Jumbo at work and play;" and cards of Jumbo in various scenes.

did.unittitle: Ringling Brothers and Barnum and Bailey Circus program
The World of Phineas T. Barnum photograph portfolio

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains a portfolio of print reproductions of portrait photographs originally taken by Matthew Brady of members of Barnum's troupe, including dancer Ernestine de Faiber, General Tom Thumb and his wife Lavinia Warren Bumpus, James Murphy (the "Irish Giant"), Anna Swan (the "Nova Scotia Giantess"), Jane Campbell (the "Fat Lady"), Isaac Sprague (the "Living Skeleton"), Mrs. Myers (first name unknown, the "Bearded Lady"), and Siamese twins Chang and Eng.
